head.supplied: 7th Novr [1886] ¶ Dear Baron von Muèller ¶ ¶ I write these lines from York, ¶ and to say that am obliged to return to the Swan ¶ — The heat here is extreme even not doing any work. I have consulted...

div.p: RB MSS M1, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

MS found with a specimen of Elachanthera sewelliae (MEL 1551044), where this is labelled Myrsiphyllum asparagoides. 7th Novr [1886]
MS dated on the basis of the accompanying collection information.

I write these lines from York,
WA. and to say that am obliged to return to the Swan
Swan River, WA. — The heat here is extreme even not doing any work. I have consulted [this] Dr and with more satisfaction than any other — he advises me to consult the Goldfield Dr. here practising and go through a course also apply a galvanic battery — He was surprised to see the waste of flesh — He told me he does not approve of medicine much — but gave me a presct
prescription? to last the week — and which has done me good — I told him what you said — and he [quite] seems to agree with you — The Gold Dr he says has the highest degrees in the colony — Also I wish to go Bunbery
Bunbury, WA? if the Dr approve — My relations have always desired me to go — these do not care very much abt me — tho they are kind enough — I must therefor reserve yr £2 until next year — when I shall make every endeavr to come in Augst, and now am making a request for shelter here then. People do not care about about an invalid, and R. M's
Not identified. daughters would have made me welcome, nevertheless — but their aged father is failing fast & suffering too frequently to allow of visters — The Line does not run far enough to suit my convenience till next yr — Some great mistake has been made between Mr [Parker] and my cousin Geraldine Sewell, and prevented my having gone, and I think occrd
occurred? for the best, as the heat more than Id bear agreeably — and will not regret the mistake.
I return to the Swan tomorrow

div.p: I send a [Jewel]. Please give name of little berry climber
